page.title: 09Northfleet Ambulance Station
page.content: Northfleet ambulance station has thirty-four ambulances.They are replaced every 14,000 miles.They cost Â£16,000.Two men travel in an ambulance.Each ambulance has a radio system.Ninety-five per cent of the work done is taking people to day centres and five per cent is accidents.They have four serious and three multiple accidents a year.All accidents are recorded on a computer in Maidstone.To become an ambulance man you have to pass an examination and do a month probation.In a week they can travel 4,300 miles. 1,227 are travelled for urgent reasons.If a call is urgent they can wait up to one hour,but if it is an emergency they leave immediately. They can get an ambulance out in one minute and they can arrive at the scene within seven minutes of the call.
